what: Add a frequency variable to targets — ar_append_frequency
title: Add a frequency variable to targets — ar_append_frequency
text: Adds variable frequency Targets associatoR object .

title: Add a frequency variable to targets — ar_append_frequency
code: ar_append_frequency(associations, source = c("cues", "responses"))

title: Add a frequency variable to targets — ar_append_frequency
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated (ar_import). source character c("cues", "responses") specifying, column Participants contains targets.

title: Add a frequency variable to targets — ar_append_frequency
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including id identify participants, potentially additional participant varables. cues tibble cues cue potentially additional cue variables. responses tibble participant's id cue r_cue response response pairs including response levels level, well potentially additional response variables targets tibble target frequency analyzed subsequent functions.

title: Add a frequency variable to targets — ar_append_frequency
code: ai_asso_imported <- ai_asso_imported %>%   ar_define_target(source = "responses") %>%   ar_target_add_frequency(source = "responses") #> Error in ar_target_add_frequency(., source = "responses"): could not find function "ar_target_add_frequency"

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: ar_embed generates abstract embedding dimensions target associations.

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
code: ar_embed(data, api, model)

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: data ar_object including targets. api character specifying api One c("huggingface","openai","cohere"). Default "huggingface". model character specifying model label. Must match model names corresponding APIs. See, huggingface.co/models, platform.openai.com/docs/models/embeddings, cohere.com/embeddings. Defaults XX api = "huggingface", "text-embedding-ada-002" api = "openai", "embed-english-v3.0" api = "cohere". type character specifying type embedding. One c("model","counts","ppmi","ppmi-svd"). Default "model".

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: function returns associatoR object including new  matrix element containing embeddings.

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (2024). associatoR. psyArXiv

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
code: # run embedding ar_embed(ai_asso_processed)

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: ar_import processes tabular association data associatoR object.

title: Import association data — ar_import
code: ar_import(   data,   participant,   cue = NULL,   cue_manual = NULL,   response,   response_level = NULL,   participant_vars = NULL,   cue_vars = NULL,   response_vars = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: data data.frame tibble containing association data. participant character scalar variable name data identifying participants. cue character scalar variable name data identifying cues. cue_manual optional character scalar specifying cue responses. Overrides argument cue. response character scalar variable name data identifying responses. response_level optional character scalar variable name data identifying response levels. participant_vars optional character vector containing additional variable names data attributes participants. cue_vars optional character vector containing additional variable names data attributes cues. response_vars optional character vector containing additional variable names data attributes responses verbose logical specifying whether show messages.

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Import association data — ar_import
code: ai_asso_imported <- ar_import(ai_asso,                               participant = "id",                               response = "association_correct",                               cue_manual = "AI",                               participant_vars = c("age", "gender", "use", "expertise"),                               response_vars = c("association", "trial"))

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: ar_normalize performs normalization steps responses (cues) wraps around ar_normalize_manual.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
code: ar_normalize(   associations,   case = "lower",   punct = "end",   punct_replacement = " ",   whitespace = "squish" )

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. case character specifying normalization cases. Must one c("lower", "upper", "sentence"). Setting case = "lower" normalizes responses lower case, case = "lower" upper case, case = "sentence" sentence case. punct character specifying normalization punctuation. Must one c("end", ""). punct = "end" replaces punctuation end (including following whitespaces) punct_replacement (default single white space). punct = "" replaces punctuation. punct_replacement character used replacement punctuation. whitespace character specifying normalization white spaces. Must one c("squish", "trim"). Setting whitespace = "squish" removes additional white spaces start, end, -words, whereas setting whitespace = "trim" removes white space start end.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
code: ai_asso <- ar_normalize(ai_asso) #> Error in ar_normalize(ai_asso): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'. ai_asso <- ar_normalize(ai_asso,                         case = "original",                         punct = "all") #> Error in ar_normalize(ai_asso, case = "original", punct = "all"): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: ar_normalize_manual offers interface add self-defined normalization steps responses (cues) associatoR objects.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
code: ar_normalize_manual(associations, fun, ..., protect_cues = TRUE)

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. fun vectorized function applied responses cues response matrix, excluding cues exist . ... additional arguments passed fun.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
code: ai_asso <- ai_asso %>% ar_normalize_manual(tolower) #> Error in ar_normalize_manual(., tolower): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'. ai_asso <- ai_asso %>% ar_normalize_manual(trimws, which = "left") #> Error in ar_normalize_manual(., trimws, which = "left"): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'.

what: ar_define_target defines the target level to further analyze in an associatoR object. This could be multiple cue words to analyze based on responses, response words to analyze based on an external embedding, or response words to analyze based on a second level of responses. — ar_set_target
title: ar_define_target defines the target level to further analyze in an associatoR object. This could be multiple cue words to analyze based on responses, response words to analyze based on an external embedding, or response words to analyze based on a second level of responses. — ar_set_target
text: ar_define_target defines target level analyze associatoR object. multiple cue words analyze based responses, response words analyze based external embedding, response words analyze based second level responses.

title: ar_define_target defines the target level to further analyze in an associatoR object. This could be multiple cue words to analyze based on responses, response words to analyze based on an external embedding, or response words to analyze based on a second level of responses. — ar_set_target
code: ar_set_target(   associations,   source = c("cues", "responses"),   response_level = 1 )

title: ar_define_target defines the target level to further analyze in an associatoR object. This could be multiple cue words to analyze based on responses, response words to analyze based on an external embedding, or response words to analyze based on a second level of responses. — ar_set_target
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated (ar_import). source character c("cues", "responses") specifying, column Participants contains targets. response_level optional positive integer specifying, response-level contains targets (defaults 1).

title: ar_define_target defines the target level to further analyze in an associatoR object. This could be multiple cue words to analyze based on responses, response words to analyze based on an external embedding, or response words to analyze based on a second level of responses. — ar_set_target
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including p_id identify participants, potentially additional participant attributes p_attr_*. cues tibble cues c_cue potentially additional cue attributes c_attr_*. responses tibble participant's p_id cue r_cue response r_response pairs including response levels r_level, well potentially additional responseattributes r_attr_*. targets tibble targets analyzed subsequent functions.

title: ar_define_target defines the target level to further analyze in an associatoR object. This could be multiple cue words to analyze based on responses, response words to analyze based on an external embedding, or response words to analyze based on a second level of responses. — ar_set_target
code: ai_asso_imported <- ai_asso_imported %>%   ar_define_target(source = "responses") #> Error in ar_define_target(., source = "responses"): could not find function "ar_define_target"

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: ar_write_csv() joins data associatoR object one table writes table disk using readr::write_csv().

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
code: ar_write_csv(associations, file, ...)

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. file character write . ... optional arguments passed readr::write_csv()

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: ar_write_csv() returns joined associations tibble invisibly.

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
code: ai_asso_imported %>%   ar_set_target("responses") %>%   ar_write_csv(file = "associations.csv") #> Error in dplyr::filter(., level == response_level): ℹ In argument: `level == response_level`. #> Caused by error: #> ! object 'level' not found
